Topic: Draw a string telephone between two students.
CAN: The student can illustrate a basic device that connects two people using cups and a string.
The student can draw two people holding cups at either end of the string, attempting to communicate.
The student can label some parts of the telephone, like 'cups' or 'string', though labels may be incomplete.
CANNOT: The student is unlikely to clearly show how the string transmits sound, such as the sound waves traveling along the string (misunderstands mechanism).
The student may not depict all necessary materials clearly, such as drawing something besides cups or improper string attachment.
The student might not clearly illustrate or explain how the string telephone is used in real life, or may show people not using the device correctly (lacks real-world context).
The student might not convincingly demonstrate how the string telephone solves the communication problem over a distance.
